channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dog / Human waste, 12th November
item.description:
Dog or human waste near drain of entrance to regal row, please clean and disinfect area immediately

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Regal Row, Nunhead, London

item.title: Rubbish not takem, 12th November
item.description:
Today is Wednesday. Yet the rubbish has not been taken. I have children under the age of 10 and this sort of litter attracts fox's and rats. Please sort this out as soon as possible.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Harleston Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unkept areas, 12th November

item.title: Pothole, 12th November
item.description:
I hit a huge Pothole in Lane 2 approaching Dartford Tunnel. It's about 1ft by 1ft and 6 inches deep. Extremely dangerous and could cause a serious accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Canterbury Way, Brooklands, Dartford

item.title: Subsiding road, 12th November
item.description:
The road has already been reported previously and has been in this state for over a year and getting worse Today a crew have been and fixed the road at end of Tenby despite this being small and not really needing it. Card sped up this road and only a matter of time before a car creates a problem, we also have a blind lady with stick who walks along and across and so could easily loose footing. The holes in some places are now through to the original 1936 layering.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brixham Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass, 12th November

Smashed prosecco bottle glass been there over a week - cannot get buggy past it

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Daubeney Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Overgrown weeds, 12th November
item.description:
This overgrown bush/weed is in children’s park which is being used by drunks and junkies, so you can imagine what’s going on behind it /in it also I think it’s extremely dangerous for young children using park I wouldn’t want any thing to happen,,, this has been reported before but still haven’t cut it down

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lancaster Street, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement heave caused by London Plain Tree, 12th November
item.description:
My elderly father (92) recently fell when he tripped over the damage to the pavement caused by the roots of a London Plain tree outside Numbers 32 and 34 Priory Avenue. Images of the bruising caused to my father can be sent but he was embarrassed and did not want to make a fuss. Priory Avenue is a tree lined road but to plant a shallow rooted large tree in this position is negligent. The image attached is self evident. I understand BCCs policy is not to remove trees which i sympathize with but this tree needs replacing with a specie more suitable to the location. Such as those already lining the Priory Avenue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Priory Avenue, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 28A & 28 Kenilworth Road, 12th November
item.description:
Pavement has been cracked for some time & slightly repaired. However main problem is the tree that needs to be pollarded as the roots have been found growing through the pipes resulting in cutting off the gas supply. As a result we have been without gas since midday yesterday. Cadent are currently doing emergency works.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kenilworth Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Remove Zipties from Post, 12th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 105, Acre Lane, Stockwell, London
